changes.reason: CSS logical property for left margin (direction-agnostic)
CSS logical property for left margin (direction-agnostic)

file_insights.scope: Layout component header with sidebar offset and icon button spacing

patterns_discovered.description: Replacing physical CSS properties (ml for margin-left) with logical equivalents (marginInlineStart) to support RTL and LTR languages
Both occurrences of 'ml' in the component were replaced, indicating systematic migration approach
patterns_discovered.scope: Same component, different contexts (main sx prop and nested IconButton)

gotchas_discovered.description: Logical properties work with both string values ('260px') and theme spacing units (1), ensuring compatibility across different value types
gotchas_discovered.impact: None - both replacement syntaxes work correctly

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully migrated Header.tsx component from physical CSS properties to logical properties
key_achievements: Maintained existing functionality and spacing values
Applied changes across different sx prop contexts (component-level and nested elements)
Enables proper RTL language support without additional code changes

recommendations.recommendation: Continue systematic migration of remaining physical properties across codebase
recommendations.rationale: This component serves as a template for similar migrations in other layout and spacing-related components
Logical properties are primarily beneficial for RTL language support, so testing in RTL context would validate the migration

recommendations.recommendation: Document the migration pattern for team reference
recommendations.rationale: With systematic migrations across multiple subtasks, maintaining a reference guide helps ensure consistency and speeds up future migrations

recommendations.recommendation: Consider using linting rules to enforce logical properties
recommendations.rationale: ESLint rules could prevent future commits of physical properties and maintain the new standard automatically
